sentences.en: Being gentle and cultivated is just a scholar's attitude.
sentences.cn: 温文尔雅正是学者的态度.

sentences.en: Corn and cotton are extensively cultivated in this region.
sentences.cn: 这个地区普遍种植玉米和蔬菜.

sentences.en: He has cultivated good relations with his neighbors.
sentences.cn: 他与他的邻居建立了良好的关系.

sentences.en: His mother was an elegant, cultivated woman.
sentences.cn: 他的母亲是一位端庄文雅的女性。

sentences.en: Howe carefully cultivated Daniel C. Roper, the Assistant Postmaster General.
sentences.cn: 豪谨慎地和邮政副部长丹尼尔·C.罗珀拉近关系。

sentences.en: Mediterranean oat held to be progenitor of modern cultivated oat.
sentences.cn: 地中海地区燕麦,被认为是现代栽种燕麦的祖先.

sentences.en: She cultivated her mind by reading many books.
The extra field cultivated meant a proportionate increase in work.
sentences.cn: 额外开发土地意味着工作量相应增加。

sentences.en: The land around here has never been cultivated.
sentences.cn: 这一带的土地从未开垦过。

sentences.en: The land here has been intensively cultivated for generations.
sentences.cn: 这片土地经过了几代人的集约耕作.

sentences.en: The land is cultivated with rice, cotton and vegetable.
sentences.cn: 地里种着水稻 、 棉花和蔬菜.

sentences.en: The outburst was inconsistent with the image he has cultivated.
sentences.cn: 这样大发脾气与他所树立的个人形象不相称。

sentences.en: This field has not been cultivated for years.
sentences.cn: 这片土地已荒废多年了.

sentences.en: We have a vast expanse of cultivated land.

words.tran_cn: 可培养的，可教化的；可耕种的
培养；耕作；耕种；教化；文雅
发展（cultivate的过去分词）；耕作；教化

trans.tran_cn: 耕种的，栽培的，有教养的
trans.tran_en: someone who is cultivated is intelligent and knows a lot about music, art, literature etc

trans.tran_cn: 耕作(cultivate的过去式和过去分词)，促进增长，教养，改善，陶冶思想[感情]建立（友谊）
